bug.author: psyciknz
bug.summary: Indexer: Updating Exif metadata in files doesn't update the index
bug.description:
I have a largish photo collection I've just added to photoprisim. From earlier cameras a lot of these photos did not have geo tagging in them, so i had been adding it (with xnview). Then I've been trying to call photoprism index --all <path to folder> and been getting hit and miss results as to whether it adds the tagging to the photo or not. I want to say it was workign 50% of the time....but there's certain directories I just can't get it to pick up anything, short of physically renaming the folder, letting it remove the old folder and reindex. I've also found that photoprism purge --hard will only remove 1 or 2 images each time it's run out of the 100 that are there. Is there something else I can do to help the re-indexing? I know xnview is keeping the original file date and time (so unsure if this is causing photoprism to miss a change), I do see it saying it's <denchmark-code>INFO[2020-10-22T19:27:02Z] index: updated main jpg file ‚Äú2004/2004-06-Fiji/FijiTrip 099.jpg‚Äù </denchmark-code>
But unless I rename the folder, that's the only time I see the places added log message.

Is it possible that there are duplicates or multiple file types / image sizes for each photo?
PhotoPrism should always use the primary file for metadata indexing, but edge cases do exist, like when there are RAW & JPEG versions of the same photo Another issue could be that metadata is merged from embedded Exif headers and JSON sidecar files (automatically genterated by exiftool); so when you update the headers but the JSON is not updated, new data might not show up
To fix this, we might have to regenerate JSON sidecar files when the main file changed. That's not implemented yet.
As a workaround, it might help to manually delete all JSON sidecar files in the storage / sidecar folder.

For further debugging, please dump the metadata as JSON grouped by type: <denchmark-code>exiftool -g -j FILENAME </denchmark-code>
You're welcome to send example files for testing to <denchmark-link:mailto:hello@photoprism.org>hello@photoprism.org</denchmark-link> . Make sure they don't contain sensitive content so that we can add them to our test suite.
